CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: According to the equation E LUMO = E HOMO + E g,opt , the LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT was calculated to be -3.43 eV. The LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT is positioned about 0.80 eV above that of PC71BM ( 4.2 eV , measured under the same condition ) , which offers enough driving force for charge separation and transfer without too much energy loss. 5,17 Transport Properties. The transport properties of the polymer were investigated by fabricating organic thin film fieldeffect transistors ( OFETs ). Typical p-channel field - effect transistor behavior was obtained. The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage. The output ( a ) and transfer characteristics ( b ) of the spin - coated PSFDTBT films are shown in Figure 2. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 , which is almost two orders higher than that of P1 ( the hole mobility of pure P1 film is 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 8 Such comparable high mobility is beneficial for charge transfer in the resulting PSCs. 5 For the PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film ( in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , spin - coated from ODCB solutions ) , hole mobility ( μ hole ) of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and electron mobility ( μ e ) of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 were obtained. I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties. Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs. Therefore , the photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT was investigated in PSCs. Polymer solar cells with a device configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al were fabricated and characterized under the illumination of AM1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM and the processing solvent have been carefully optimized. The results are summarized in Table 1. Using DCB as the processing solvent , four polymer solar cells with blends of PSFDTBT and PC71BM in weight ratios of 1 : 2.5 , 1 : 3 , 1 : 3.5 , and 1 : 4 , respectively , as the active layer were fabricated , and their J-V curves are shown in Figure 3a. In all cases , PCEs of about 4.1% were obtained.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PSFDTBT: Mentioned several times in the paragraph, this is the donor material being studied.
2. PC71BM: Mentioned in the paragraph as a comparative material, this is the acceptor material used in the blends with PSFDTBT.
3. P1: Mentioned in the paragraph as a pure material, this is another comparative material used for comparison with PSFDTBT.
4. ITO: Mentioned in the paragraph as a material used for the electrode, this is the indium tin oxide (ITO) electrode used in the fabrication of the organic thin film field-effect transistors (OFETs).
5. PEDOT: Mentioned in the paragraph as a material used for the electrode, this is the poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) (PEDOT) electrode used in the fabrication of the OFETs.
6. PSS: Mentioned in the paragraph as a material used for the electrode, this is the polystyrene sulfonate (PSS) electrode used in the fabrication of the OFETs.
7. LiF: Mentioned in the paragraph as a material used in the fabrication of the solar cells, this is the lithium fluoride (LiF) layer used as a buffer layer in the solar cells.
8. Al: Mentioned in the paragraph as a material used in the fabrication of the solar cells, this is the aluminum (Al) layer used as the electrode in the solar cells.

These are the "Material Name" entities mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. PSFDTBT
2. PC71BM

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities mentioned in the paragraph as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Paragraph: According to the equation E LUMO = E HOMO + E g,opt , the LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT was calculated to be -3.43 eV. The LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT is positioned about 0.80 eV above that of PC71BM ( 4.2 eV , measured under the same condition ) , which offers enough driving force for charge separation and transfer without too much energy loss. 5,17 Transport Properties. The transport properties of the polymer were investigated by fabricating organic thin film fieldeffect transistors ( OFETs ). Typical p-channel field - effect transistor behavior was obtained. The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage. The output ( a ) and transfer characteristics ( b ) of the spin - coated PSFDTBT films are shown in Figure 2. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 , which is almost two orders higher than that of P1 ( the hole mobility of pure P1 film is 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 8 Such comparable high mobility is beneficial for charge transfer in the resulting PSCs. 5 For the PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film ( in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , spin - coated from ODCB solutions ) , hole mobility ( μ hole ) of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and electron mobility ( μ e ) of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 were obtained. I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties. Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs. Therefore , the photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT was investigated in PSCs. Polymer solar cells with a device configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al were fabricated and characterized under the illumination of AM1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM and the processing solvent have been carefully optimized. The results are summarized in Table 1. Using DCB as the processing solvent , four polymer solar cells with blends of PSFDTBT and PC71BM in weight ratios of 1 : 2.5 , 1 : 3 , 1 : 3.5 , and 1 : 4 , respectively , as the active layer were fabricated , and their J-V curves are shown in Figure 3a. In all cases , PCEs of about 4.1% were obtained.

Let's think step by step.

1. Materials mentioned in the paragraph:
 * PSFDTBT
 * PC71BM
 * P1
 * ODCB
 * DCB
 * ITO
 * PEDOT
 * PSS
 * LiF
 * Al
2. Property names mentioned in the paragraph:
 * LUMO energy level
 * HOMO energy level
 * hole mobility (μ)
 * electron mobility (μe)
 * photovoltaic performance
 * weight ratio
 * processing solvent
 * J-V curves
 * PCE (power conversion efficiency)
3. Material properties:
 * PSFDTBT:
  + LUMO energy level: -3.43 eV
  + HOMO energy level: not mentioned
  + Hole mobility (μ): 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (pristine)
  + Electron mobility (μe): not mentioned
 * PC71BM:
  + LUMO energy level: not mentioned
  + HOMO energy level: 4.2 eV (measured under same conditions)
  + Hole mobility (μ): not mentioned
  + Electron mobility (μe): not mentioned
 * P1:
  + LUMO energy level: not mentioned
  + HOMO energy level: not mentioned
  + Hole mobility (μ): 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (pure film)
  + Electron mobility (μe): not mentioned
4. Transport properties:
 * Hole mobility (μ) of PSFDTBT: 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (saturated regime)
 * Electron mobility (μe) of PSFDTBT: not mentioned
 * Hole mobility (μ) of PC71BM: not mentioned
 * Electron mobility (μe) of PC71BM: not mentioned
5. Photovoltaic properties:
 * Broad absorption of PSFDTBT
 * Appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions of PSFDTBT
 * Comparison of PSFDTBT with PC71BM:
  + PSFDTBT has higher hole mobility
  + PSFDTBT has comparable hole mobility to PC71BM
  + PSFDTBT has higher PCE (4.1%) than PC71BM (not mentioned)
6. Processing solvents:
 * ODCB (organic dissolving solvent)
 * DCB (dissolving solvent)
7. Device configuration:
 * ITO (indium tin oxide)
 * PEDOT (poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
 * PSS (polystyrene sulfonate)
 * PC71BM (polymer: poly[7,7'-bis(1-naphthyl)-2,1'-bithiophene])
 * LiF (lithium fluoride)
 * Al (aluminum)

Note: The properties mentioned in the paragraph are based on the information provided and may not be exhaustive.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to the property name of a material:

1. PSFDTBT (Polymer Solar Cell with Fluorinated Diborane Thienylene-Boronitriene)
2. PC71BM (Polymer: Poly[7,7'-bis(1-naphthyl)-2,1'-bithiophene])

These are the only two entities in the text that refer directly to the property name of a material.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, let's identify the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT: -3.43 eV
2. HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT: Not mentioned
3. E g,opt: Not mentioned
4. Mobility of PSFDTBT: 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
5. Mobility of pure P1 film: 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
6. Hole mobility of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend film: 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
7. Electron mobility of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend film: 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
8. Capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer: 7.5 nF/cm^2
9. Threshold voltage (V T): Not mentioned
10. On/off ratios of PSFDTBT films: In the order of 10^5
11. Photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT in PSCs: Broad absorption, appropriate HOMO/LUMO positions, and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs.

Note: The values of material properties are given in units of energy (eV), length (cm), and mobility (cm^2 V^-1 s^-1), unless otherwise specified.
